com.ceteva.mosaic

Class MessageDialogWithToggle

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.jface.window.Window
      • org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.Dialog
        • org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.IconAndMessageDialog
          • org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.MessageDialog
            • com.ceteva.mosaic.MessageDialogWithToggle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.jface.window.IShellProvider

    public class MessageDialogWithToggle
extends org.eclipse.jface.dialogs.MessageDialog
    A message dialog which also allows the user to adjust a toggle setting. This is typically used to allow the user to indicate whether the dialog should be shown in the future.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class org.eclipse.jface.window.Window

        org.eclipse.jface.window.Window.IExceptionHandler

    • Constructor Detail

      • MessageDialogWithToggle

        public MessageDialogWithToggle(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell parentShell,
                       java.lang.String dialogTitle,
                       org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image image,
                       java.lang.String message,
                       int dialogImageType,
                       java.lang.String[] dialogButtonLabels,
                       int defaultIndex,
                       java.lang.String toggleMessage,
                       boolean toggleState)
        Creates a message dialog with a toggle. See the superclass constructor for info on the other parameters.
        Parameters:
        parentShell - the parent shell
        dialogTitle - the dialog title
        image - the image
        message - the message
        dialogImageType - the dialog image type
        dialogButtonLabels - the dialog button labels
        defaultIndex - the default index
        toggleMessage - the message for the toggle control, or null for the default message ("Do not show this message again").
        toggleState - the initial state for the toggle

    • Method Detail

      • getToggleState

        public boolean getToggleState()
        Returns the toggle state. This can be called even after the dialog is closed.
        Returns:
        true if the toggle button is checked, false if not

      • openConfirm

        public static MessageDialogWithToggle openConfirm(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell parent,
                                  java.lang.String title,
                                  java.lang.String message,
                                  java.lang.String toggleMessage,
                                  boolean toggleState)
        Convenience method to open a simple confirm (OK/Cancel) dialog.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent shell of the dialog, or null if none
        title - the dialog's title, or null if none
        message - the message
        toggleMessage - the message for the toggle control, or null for the default message ("Don't show me this message again").
        toggleState - the initial state for the toggle
        Returns:
        the dialog, after being closed by the user, which the client can only call getReturnCode() or getToggleState()
